Review.Titre: Data Privacy Concerns with Hostinger Account
Review.Contenu: I am concerned about the security of my personal data associated with my Hostinger account. Recently, I have been receiving unsolicited commercial emails and phishing attempts from a domain impersonating Hostinger. These messages are sent to an email address exclusively created for and used with Hostinger, which I have not shared publicly. Additionally, I am receiving marketing communications from third-party companies to the same email address. Notably, the phishing emails seem to be specifically targeted, indicating awareness of my Hostinger account. I want to clarify that my device is secure, and there have been no breaches in my email security. This situation leads me to suspect either a compromise of Hostinger's database or an unauthorized sharing of customer information with external parties. I am seeking an explanation and urgent resolution to this matter.Update:Thank you for your prompt response. I have provided all the requested information and am now awaiting your team's investigation into the recent issue I have encountered.While I am pleased with the service overall, I would like to emphasize that privacy is of paramount importance to me.

Review.Titre: Hostinger can block your site at their discretion
Review.Contenu: My website has been operational since 2014. This is the first and only time I have encountered the issue of my site being blocked. Users on my site can leave comments, and it turns out that the hosting provider, Hostinger, can essentially disable your site if they believe any comments on your site violate their internal hosting policies. In this way, they indirectly censor your site. I do not recommend or advise this hosting service if you are creating a review and comment platform.(29.11.2023)I just believe that it’s an excessive measure to halt the operations of the entire site. Also, a warning about the impending block could have been sent not only via email but also displayed in my account. Now, I’m considering a hosting service with a different content moderation policy. I’ve also reached out to the author of the comment (which led to the site being shut down) and informed him that his comment was removed due to a site-blocking threat from my hosting provider. The issue can now be considered resolved.

I’ve been on live chat on and off for weeks trying to sort a straightforward transfer of domain from hostinger to hostinger. I’m often ignored and my requests for help come to nothing. I write this review in the hope someone reads from hostinger reads this and helps

Well, I own a marketing agency and we do different test and buy different domains for temporary projects. My problem is that they should not have that auto renewal feature enabled by default because the you get charge for something you don't want and If someone wants to enable it they can opt for it. Because I got charged and support said we can't refund and suggested me to sell it on SEDO. I went on that website and hostinger was not even in the list of registrars. Then I contacted again and they suggested few other steps. Isn't that an amazing corporate excuse of let us keep charging you for the things you don't even need or remember that you have. Most of the people won't even go to SEDO to go through all hassle but even if you do TADA! they don't even exist in their list.

I have been with Hostinger for two years and I can say with certainty that in the past 6 months the Customer Support has gone from ok to utterly hopeless.You can now expect to wait a minimum of 15 minutes for each reply, and then you will get a canned response that is often unrelated to your problem.The service team are clearly dealing with more people than they can cope with and are not sufficiently trained. I would NOT recommend Hostinger based on recent experience. And I will reluctantly be migrating my websites to a competent host asap.

Review.Titre: Very poor speed & Database import issue
Review.Contenu: Over the past few months, I've noticed a significant decline in server speed. My website, which used to load swiftly, now takes an agonizingly long time to fully load. This issue occurs consistently, impacting the user experience and, consequently, my business.    The constant database import failures have caused significant delays in my project's launch timeline. As a developer, time is of the essence, and these issues have not only been frustrating but have also incurred additional costs and time investments.We are send video to support team but not accepting issue in server side very bad service

Moving website is very confusing. Once you submit a request, you have to submit it a second time to get the migration to happen. If you check the status they use the word "Update" meaning in progress, which lead us to breaking 2 sites at first until we figured this out. SMTP over 25 using auto TLS doesn't work. Seems like they block port 25 from working with SMTP. Most of their features force you to setup DNS and email with them instead of 3rd parties. Customer services very unresponsive. I opened a chat window and was told they respond normally within 5 minutes, i waited almost 8 hours before hearing from them.

Review.Titre: Hostinger customer service is super poor
Review.Contenu: Hostinger customer service is as bad as Nigerian customer services or worse. They promise 24/7 support and 4 minutes live chat delay but do not reply to live chats for 30 minutes to several hours. Even when they do, the chat is set to automatically close. So you can't continue a previous chat. The individual customer service personnel are nice and does their "delayed best".  This poor service has left my sites down for 5 days and counting, hurting my seo and earnings.

fucki** customer support, i have 4 hosting plans with hostinger their service was good. but from last 2 months there service is like garbage, no one even reply on customer support chat, waiting from last 3 days to get reply but there is no hope from hostinger. fuc*** up to use their service. getting error, server not responding. and there customer support also not responding. :/

The worst service ever.. Hostinger are without a doubt the worst company I have ever had the displeasure of dealing with. The alleged 24/7 customer support is complete and utter rubbish. Extremely poor and unbothered customer care personnel. Only some are helpful AFTER they notice how angry you are.

Review.Titre: Unreliable, poor service delivery and equally poor customer service. Money grabbers and cheats.
Review.Contenu: Their service is unreliable and cannot be trusted. My website keeps going down on and off because of Hostinger faults. I am losing money because of that. Hostinger blames others and doesn't admit their faults. Poor service and equally poor customer service. Engineers and so called 'customer service' from some remote locations in third world countries don't care about customers. They probably don't even know what customer service is. Hostinger is a joke. The only thing they do is take your money and treat you like a fool.

Hidden costs, Why??After reading a lot of reviews through different magazines we decided to give Hostinger a try. This is NOT what we expected. First- This site is complicated to navigate. Second- the worst is that u leave the customer unsecure cause of all commercials. Usually costumers pays to get rid of all the advertising- signing up for free ok,,,,,but as a paid customer, not acceptableU did all of the sudden billed us for a domain name we have no absolutely use for.From the beginning we did have a mailplan, the free one, only 1 gb each account- that was to small for us.And when we updated our mailplan- it was no option to connect the paid plan to the domain of ours. Instead we had to open a new domain!!!A refund has been requested and we will see if they manage to live up to their costumer information such as the 30 days money back guaranteeWe will of course update this information as the days go by..Sad to tell, but no more Hostinger- as it has been a bad experience for us..To be fair- A refund has been made. And the support has been all ok. .But they have allocated the cost to another domain that we don't even needed. And for this domain you cant claim a refund..In order- You buy a domain- lets say a .com- You select a free email to that domain name, later you discover the mailbox is to small for you. Then you can NOT change the email address if you upgrade and want  a bigger inbox on the same domain!!! Instead u have to buy a new Domain and use the upgraded mailbox.....Ohh I give up!! Cause its really weird...!!- Let us hope they will change this complicated way of upgrading a simple mailbox.

Do not use this platform. Not only does the platform work horribly but the customer service is terrible. Whatever you do, don't ever provide them with your card info. You will regret it.

After being a client of Hostinger for over 3 years we came into the office to find our emails suspended and web site pulled downThe company made no effort to contact us before doing soWhen we contacted their customer service to assist us we were told that a complaint had been made by another company in another country that we were trying to impersonate them.Hostinger immediately shut our service down without contacting us first to hear our story.Over 24 Hours has past with us providing proof that we are an Australian Registered Company with a legitimate Australian Registered Trading Name and we are still down.Email address added is a gmail address as our "legitimate" company email address has been suspended.If you are a business - and cant afford to be shut down with no notice - DONT USE THESE GUYS!

I have been using Hostinger for a year and have had non-stop problems with emails and hosting. Their customer support is awful. They have lost me lots of customers over technical problems that they just don't sort out or care about. AVOID this company!!!

Absolutely some of the worst customer service and knowledge.  Setup and transfer of a site just horrid. Seems like they like to break plugins and when a plugin is working one day and not the next.

There is 2 big issue .. domain and hosting renewal that auto renewal without notify take your money then if ask refund never giving back. then may forced paypal dispute your payment method of paypal disable and only non refundable crypto payment. other issue is renewal price very expensive that auto silent renewal take your big money that you start fight refund me and issue case. about hosting is better performance. i decide to go other alternate hosting.
very dissatisfied with the service. They increased the price of the service by 1000% without prior notice. It was very detrimental to my business. I am going to migrate all sites to another provider

Good looking dashboard and helpful staff using chat,  they will give you templated replies, but if there's anything more complicated you will need to ask several times to get to the answer. We also found that the 100 website package "ran out of resources' after adding just a handful of websites. I think hostinger is aimed at basic users with 1 website. If you are a web-designer or an agency look elsewhere as you will end up going around and round in circles trying to get a straight answer. Additionally, As an agency, we tried to give one of our clients to Hostinger, setup the site for them and instructed them, but hostinger support took weeks to answer some very simple questions and take our client off our hands. We will not refer any more clients to hostinger after that poor experience.

Really poor customer service. My new website which has hardly any content is running painfully slow despite taking optimization steps. I have now been waiting for over 20 minutes for a reply from their online chat which says their response time is in under 2 minutes. Previous contact with Hostinger support has been just as disappointing. I run 3 websites through them and I will be looking to change hosting provider soon. Stop spending all your budget on advertising Hostinger and invest it into making your product and services for existing customers not just better but actually functional!

Looked good, fizzled quickly.I scoured for weeks for a new platform to switch to. I tried one company in Canada, sales was useless and that's already a bad sign. Then I came across Hostinger. Read the good and bad, but after a few days, decided to try it out without switching all my web pages over. Tried to switch one over. Error after error. I couldn't even transfer one domain over successfully for various reasons. I have everything working on my current Cpanel. Switching to Hostinger's Admin panel looks attractive, but that's where it ends. Within the first 3 days of signing up, I had to contact support 3 times. They replied with online chat fairly quickly, but problems were not resolved at all. In the end, I had a bunch of domains to transfer over, plus wanted to sign up new customers to hosting there, but it became very discouraging and after the first few days. I can only imagine if I asked them to transfer everything for me, what could have happened. I just stopped using it today. I got billed for my 2nd month and the price went up $5 from my original fee. After seeing that, I just cancelled my membership.

Incredible high renwewal prices. I discovered hostinger 1 year ago and purchased domain name for a few dıllars and host service at a very reasonable price. Fortunately I immediately turned off auto-renewal property as I had previous experiences with other hosting companies. At the end of 1 year period the domain price went up to 75.-USD, yes indeed 75.-USD. And the hosting service about 40.-USD. Fortunately I only used the services for development purposes so I am not obliged to keep the domain. So when you purchase pls beware how high the prices go up after first year. Otherwise the service etc were great. No complaints about that. But this kind of pricing policy is quite disturbing.

Hard to find support, difficult domain transfers, errors galore and service down. Just a few issues I suffered when transferring my business and 4 websites to Hostinger. Not a straightforward process by any means. Three months later and I am still losing business, as many issues have not been fixed. I deeply regret transferring from Siteground, which was too expensive, but you clearly get what you pay for. I would not recommend unless you are an experienced web developer, with time to fix numerous issues without support.

Quality dropped on Amsterdam servers drastically in the past weeks. Hostinger was our go-to provider but if you are an Agency managing more than 400 domains. Look elsewhere. Problem is getting to senior support managers or any kind of account managers to try to work the issue with you.You have first level support gatekeepers who try to smoothen out issues they have with DNS, mail and most importantly making websites offline. Recently they just deleted AAAA records from the server so all domains that we do not manage the DNS directly are down until we adjust DNS manually and remove the AAAA records that were once there. All this is done with no prior communication to clients. So you need to figure the issue out and fix it yourself.Hostinger is not made for web professionals or agencies working with many clients and people who use their hPanel every single work day.

Review.Titre: Hostinger is really nice platform but…
Review.Contenu: Hostinger is really nice platform but hostinger support system want to improve because lots of males on hostinger support not helping. They just wasting time.

them support is fast and very good. But hostinger has very big limit for backup. business and cloud hosting has automatic daily backup and can not change to manual. If you take backup one time in one of your website you can not take backup on your other website in 24 hours. For backups for each website separately you have to install plugins on that site or take a backup by ftp and they are complicated for backup and restore. I subscribed to a business email account. I then found out a couple months later that there was a conflict with the business name and so I needed to change my domain. I asked Hostinger support if I could associate the new domain to the email plan I was paying for. I was told that I needed to purchase a new email plan for the new domain. I tried to ask if they can just downgrade the plan on the original domain and then give me the upgrade for my new domain for free... they said no because they will not issue a refund for the original account I'll no longer be using because it's over 30 days (it's been 48 days). Why in the world can they not change the domain associated to the email plan? I am a 1 star level upset about this and am now looking at alternative providers, but I've given 2 Stars because I do actually like their services and I know it's going to be a pain to find another provider whose services I like (but hoping the customer service will be better elsewhere).

Let me be honest with you. They are giving the best hosting service out there. I have used almost all hosting services. They are also not bad. But Hostinger's user experience and performance is much cooler & awesome than others. However, Hostinger's customer support is the worst one. I had to contact their live support many times, first they appear on chatbot after 10 minutes. And then they take like another 10 minutes to reply one line and so on. So if you are not a technical person who can't google and sort out problems on your own, as a Hostinger user, you're out of luck.The other features are very cool though. Their hpanel, UX/UI, AI systems, everything is way better than Bluehost, Hostgator, Namecheap or Godaddy. Their only problem is live support. (Maybe the reason is their AI support or a lot of helpful blogs and Youtube videos - so they thought there is no room for live support maybe).That's the honest review from me. Best wishes.

Getting contact to customer support is tricky. No telephone support. Very basic webpage building possibilities. Paying with services like Sofort result in unfulfilling payment processes and multiple payments.

I would like to bring to your attention some concerns I have encountered during the recent website migration process to Hostinger. I believe addressing these issues will contribute to enhancing the overall quality of service.It appears that the support provided lacks commitment in its responsiveness, particularly during critical situations and urgent needs. The level of service in these circumstances has been perceived as weak and irresponsibly handled.Database Naming Request:I have been actively involved in the website migration process for several days. Unfortunately, my initial request regarding the customization of the second part of the database's name, a feature supposedly changeable, has not been acknowledged. Despite multiple communications with the customer service team, this seemingly straightforward request remains unfulfilled.Incomplete Site Migration:Upon being notified of the successful completion of the migration process, it came to my attention that the site had not been fully transferred. Essential components such as subdomains, databases, and email accounts were overlooked by the migration team and not moved to Hostinger.Disorganized Files:The extracted files from the backup are disorganized, leading to unnecessary additions of folders and files. This has resulted in increased inode usage and memory consumption.Refund Operation:I purchased a plan with the expectation of a smooth refund process. Despite providing my order number to customer service and assurances that no charges would be deducted, an amount for the initially promised free domain was deducted. Regrettably, when I pursued this matter, I received only an apology without a resolution.

Dear Hostinger, been a few days and I still can't access my website to finishing build it. My hosting located in server SG 1024, while my other websites located in server SG 1100 and it all work just fine. So sorry, but this is the first time I face trouble like this with Hostinger, fix this problem and I will edit my 2 stars

Review.Titre: Hostinger No Payment Portal Availabilty in Argentina
Review.Contenu: I've been working on an online store for a client in Argentina and I couldn't find the option to add an online payment portal such as Stripe or Paypal. Stripe does not support that country but Paypal does. I asked their customer support why I cannot add or link the Paypal payment option and they advised it is not supported for the region or country. Then I sent the customer support rep a link showing that Hostinger provides hosting services in Argentina hostinger.com.ar and also the ecommerce option with 500 product limit. So what payment portals do they use if that is the case? I have the Paypal business account in Argentina which means that they service that country but the only thing the customer rep said is that there is a currency issue where Paypal does not accept ARS$, that is the whole point of the exchange rate if dealt with another currency. If you don't want to have issues with payment portal options with Hostinger, I suggest you research more on the hosting provider and ensure the options you are looking for are available especially if it will be an online store. Thank you

Review.Contenu: Nice marketing and website, reasonable price, fast load times (when working) however...  Transferring to Hostinger has been extremely stressful and expensive in expert support from fiverr.The main problem right now is that Hostinger keep blocking me (and others) from my own websites - I simply cannot get onto them.  Their help (which is really poor) blames my home ISP but now my mobile data and IT consultant have now been blocked too.  Works just fine from Belgium and Birmingham ... but I don't live there.  They say to try a different server but don't seem interested in understanding the cause of the problem or actually fixing it.Another problem is that they don't offer a wordpress.com migration service.  Part of the reason I moved was to have all my websites in the same place.  Frustrating.When migrating it is seems to be impossible to preview the new website without changing the nameservers and making it go live.  Tried for ages to try to understand how to do this but just got copy / paste responses to change my 'hosts file' - which didn't work.  It is possible that this is related to the first issue about being blocked from my own sites but all the 'help' seem unable (or too stretched) to actually take the time to understand the problem and, you know, help with it.Stressful and disappointing.

The hosting service is good, but they fail to tell you that a 3rd party handles their email service. The service is called Titan Email and it has some pathetic limitations on hourly send rates. Hostinger's "H Panel" is also extremely limiting. If you come from using Cpanel, expect to feel a lackluster feeling in your gut as you try to do basic things with extremely limited tools. The price for hosting is the ONLY upside to using this service, if you want good customer service and expansive tools and loose limitations, look elsewhere.Edit: To Hostinger, Where did you send htis account request? There is no request on Trustpilot or my email telling me that you are requesting anything. Please resubmit your request because it was not received.

On previous instances I was sent poorly written guides or  referred to third party posts created by good-willed guys who had certainly experienced the same misery. Review.Titre: The pricing is ok, customer support is severely understaffed
Review.Contenu: The pricing is ok, but I have serious issues with the server response time. I moved away from cloudways to hostinger, even though there is more recources available, the website is for some reason slower. I have contacted their support, but the support is very UNDERSTAFFED. It seems there is 3-4 people in support, they take your ticket and wait for 20-30 minutes to respond. The customer support side is horrific, the owner of hostinger should be ashamed of himself not hiring more support agents.

1. My only experience with tech support took way too long and the agent kept sending me web links written in technical language instead of personally answering my question.  (My question was how to log in to Wordpress.org directly instead of via Hostinger. This problem required technical knowledge to fix it in Cpanel.)2. Hostinger controls have somehow become embedded in my Wordpress dashboard, so that only the editing to my website done through Hostinger's dashboard appears in my live website.  All the changes I've made to my website since logging in directly to Wordpress do not appear on my live website.  Now I have to go through another agonizing live chat session with Hostinger support to fix this annoying problem.

Review.Titre: Unable to migrate a wordpress site from ionos
Review.Contenu: I chose hostinger because of their free website migration offer, unfortunately they were unable to migrate my basic wordpress website from ionos. I don't have the the technical knowledge to do this myself and their staff seemed unable to help, each instruction they gave me was incorrect or didn't work. Luckily they offer a 30 day money back guarantee, I claimed a refund and it was processed immediately, I was actually very surprised that nobody even tried to keep my business it was just an automated refund system!

Not advised for Newbies!…Terrible support!Website looks good, services look good but can’t contact anyone for support!Just go round in circles trying to get the answers/support!… a simple online chat button would make it very simple!Not possible to call either!After paying £206.84 for what I thought was a domain, email & website turned out to be a nightmare & just seemed to be hidden costs!Tried navigating the site for a couple of hours before giving up & deciding to cancel! They offer a 30-day money back guarantee so will see that they honour this & how quickly it’s done & update my review accordingly.UPDATE:…Full refund received, so I can confirm they do honour their refund policy.Asked to provide more details to prove my review is genuine?… Where/how do I provide these details to you without posting them online in my review?The email address provided for the registration should prove my review is genuine?!

Hostinger is a great service until it comes to support. Their support team is ridiculous as they never know the problem and just say things to get you off their back. We have been with them for a couple years now and downtime has been worse than ever due to small things like PHP updates on their end that break our wordpress sites. If we talk to support they will tell us our plugins are causing issues or things that don't support anything related. This is the 5th time it's happened or I wouldn't complain. No phone number for support either...

I had 4 cloud servers with Hostinger in lst year or so.  I have had nothing but issues from extremely slow performance to SSL issues and many more issues.  Right now, I cannot do anything within my hosting account as any page wont load such as backups, file manager etc...  When contacting support, they seem to come up with excuses and don’t take ownership at times and blame things like my optimziation of my websites or my internet speed which causes me to load my hosting plan slow. lol, I have super fast fiber internet thank you very much.I had so many websites on other servers running c panel and they loaded super fast, I put on one of their cloud platforms with a lot of specs and the websites load fast at one time, then super slow at another time.  Just an over all bad experience which I truly regret using. The one thing I do like is the support and they are normally very friendly and most times fast, however I cannot rely on everything running smoothly and I dont want to worry about issues and should not have to but I do.

Review.Titre: From dismal customer service to adequate
Review.Contenu: Aug 8 update - Thank you Hostinger for emailing me after the review below was published. The issue is indeed resolved with your help. AI is a great technology, but human communication is still the best at this point (thankfully!).Aug 6 - I signed up about a month ago (2 domain names + hosting). The "product" itself is fine (control panel, tech stuff, WP intergration,etc). HOWEVER the "Customer Success team" is an AI which is unable to address out-of-the-box issues. When you have one of those, you are sucked into a black hole, and you remain stuck. I was billed twice on the same day for one domain registration + 2 accounts seem to have been created, although both with the same email address, and merging them or somehow resolving the issue appears impossible. At this point, I just want to cancel everything and go elsewhere - but how? The AI "helper" doesn't want to address that either. eeek! I never write these types of reviews - but it might be the only way to attract the attention of a real human to address the technical glitches I am facing. Time is our most precious asset. I have now lost many hours trying to resolve this. PS: I have 20+ years experience with various hosts. Wanted to give Hostinger a try.
Instructions inconsistent with pages and sequence of steps does not match. Impossible to find out what the DNSs are.

Review.Titre: Hostinger Sitemaps are not being Indexed by Google
Review.Contenu: Truth be told, I have multiple websites and the one I have in Hostinger seems not to be indexed by Google, even after nearly 5 months of being active. My site in GoDaddy seems to be indexing so fast, even without me submitting no Sitemaps to Google. Sitemap for my Hostinger website won't even be read by Google and contacting support provided no help in regards with this.

Review.Titre: Hosting Prices for renewal shown in the Hpanel are more than shown on their website.
Review.Contenu: Their regular renewal price is $6.99 per month as shown on their website but after I made a purchase it shows $11.99 per month in the Hpanel for renewal. Upon requesting a refund, they deducted $9.99 of the domain that was FREE to begin with. It's UNFAIR to be charged for something later when it was free to start with!!! They have not mentioned this on the website. So it's a tricky little way to snatch money.

Review.Titre: It used to be good, but now…
Review.Contenu: Feel like this service was good previously, but sadly with time is just getting worse and worse.Customer service is generally not very helpful or personal and their replies are literally copy/paste with tutorials which I could find myself with a Google search. Not to mention that more than half the time I have to keep insisting on a better solution because I feel like they just can't be asked to check the best answer for my problems. Oh, and don't get me started with when I explain or inform them of something and after 30 minutes / 1 hour the agent asks me about that particular thing I have explained or mentioned before. Very constant and frustrating!The service itself can be affordable, but I keep spending time trying to fix problems with certain features like emails, or even website transfers.Overall, quite disappointing to see where it's heading.

2 star for customer service, otherwise I will give it 1star, I bought a domain at 8.46pm , and was waiting for it's verification ,But by then someone had taken it, it was my worst experience on Hostinger. But those people are saying that someone else had taken it before me. My question is that if someone else had taken it then why was the domain available. Very bad experience.

Review.Titre: Frequent degraded performance issues and poor supportI have been using hostinger for several…
Review.Contenu: I have been using hostinger for several years. Recently, the newly purchased VPS server in US has 2 degraded performance issues in less than two months. The 100 Mb/s Network described on the official website has dropped to less than one tenth. I contacted their support and the customer service just made me wait patiently and rejected my partial refund request, so the fact is that I can't use it, and I still can't get a partial refund when their service description is not true, I just want Tell everyone that if you want to buy VPS services from here you need to really think carefully, I will not buy any services from here again.---------------Even if I can't apply for a partial refund, at least they should move my server to another node with no degraded performance issues, it should be easy, and I have told that I don't need to keep any data, but their support will only tell me let me wait. I've waited too long and this is a waste of my time and money.-----------Sep 1, 2023I hope anyone who wishes to purchase their service plan should check their statuspage. The US data center has not recovered performance for at least a month, and I am unable to transfer my server location. Their online support is useless and mechanically answers your question.

Billed me for my email address (which i wanted to keep).Next day billed me separately for my domain, which was a lot more expensive.Said I couldn't use the email address without the domain. I asked for a refund on the original payment, within 24 hours, but they refused.
My ads do not appear, then it gets fixed, then the problem happens again.At first the clicks I received were useless and from only 2 countries and one state, which is not at all what I wanted.

Review.Titre: They closed down my new site because of their own domain
Review.Contenu: They closed down my new site! I purchased a year's Business Plan plus a free domain. The domain was one suggested by Hostinger's domain registration tool. So I assumed it was safe to use.I did nothing with the domain other than have their support change the MX records to point to Google's servers ( I did not even set up a website).A few days later, out of the blue I receive an email stating "....has been suspended due to the following reason: abuse"Support could not say anything other than the domain (they provided!) was linked to phising. They explained I would need to appeal to have it unsuspended and if unsuccessful I would lose my money.Support eventually came back after investigating and unblocked my account. They could not give me any explanation as to what happened.I immediately asked for a refund. I cannot trust my business on a service that would cut you off without a plausible reason and when I had  not even installed a file or website on the domain.

Review.Titre: Well poor is not the right word
Review.Contenu: Well, the first server was full, so they moved my site to another. In this they lost our company emails. The site broke several times due to server errors and Hostinger staff. Have not gotten any compensation and we were denied our money back due to their "policy". They have great staff don´t ge me wrong, but also absolutely devastatingly poor staff. If you have a Woocommerce site.. Stay away! If you can not stand a host that sends you articles on how to fix and learn how to fix server related issues.. Stay away!

I am still waiting.

Review.Contenu: I recently purchased a hosting plan with Hostinger and initially thought it was a good deal until 2 months later they brought out a significant improvement but wanted to charge over double the price it would cost to simply buy the upgraded package again as a new customer. I decided to buy the upgraded package but then I was charged £50 to move my website from the old package to the new package and was refused a cashback offer on my second purchase and the customer accounts department are totally unhelpful in every way. Make sure you pick exactly what you need from them as you will not get any help just big bills if you need to upgrade after the first 30 days....

I transferred to Hostinger from another web host based on their good reviews but within a few hours of having my website live with them, I hit the memory usage limit on my hosting plan (all I was doing was updating a page on my Wordpress site) and I was forced to upgrade to their Business Plan, despite my website being a simple 4 page personal portfolio. I thought that would've fixed things, but I then kept getting database connection errors every time I tried to edit one of my pages. After spending literally all day on their online chat and them pointing me to lists of "helpful articles" and getting nowhere, I cloned the website on another hosting server and all the errors went away.On a "Business Plan" advertised to host 100 websites, I was hitting usage limits with 1 personal website hosted. Appalling.

Hi, I have been on hostinger for a long time now. So far everything has been going well until today. currently my platform is uses a lot of resources on the database and I get  more issue. Every day I have a memory issue that arises.

For speed purposes it is good, but not for emails.I have purchased a hostinger plan for 4 years.I can create 100 email accounts based on the domain as they suggest.Last week- I started sending emails to my users - and it is 130000 something. but as per the limit of account -I can send a total of 15000 emails from one account. and in 24 hours I can send a maximum of 500.So I have created 4 email accounts in my account. and I created a cron to send email to users.After some hours, the hostinger sent me emails with the title "Undelivered Mail Returned to Sender '' - and updated my email account status to suspended. After that i can not send email to users - it has the same issue again and again. so I reactivate status. but it has the same result.also when i create a new email account it has the same issue, it can not send email to users.I reached chat and email support, I don't know what they do, but emails work fine after they reach support, but every 2-3 days the same issue occurs again.I have sent only 1143 emails from 130000, what is the meaning of 100 accounts ... if you can not send email from any single account perfectly.

My 2 stars do not refer to the product itself (I have a domain with Hostinger) but to the customer care system. If you do not need particular help, it is all fine but if you need to get in contact with them, 7 working days or even 1 working day can easily become weeks or months if you do not keep reminding them you are waiting for some help. I could not access my account anymore because the 2AF was not supported by my phone anymore and so I had to wait for more than a month to have this problem solved. Not being able to access my account, and so to the chat with experts, meant that the only mean of communication were emails managed by many different people with a lack of internal shared infomation resulting in asking for info already provided or telling me the info were not available while two days before they had already granted me the access. Customer care is really important when you deal with online services and if this bomes difficult, then you start to look if there are better providers.As my domain hasn't being effectively used by me for a website, I cannot say if there are practical problems or difficulties in using this product but I will certainly think about what it is better to do in terms of keeping the domain with Hostinger or moving it to another hosting provider. So, all things considered, I would strongly recommend Hostinger to improve the responding time and customer care efficiency when peopole, for any reasons, cannot access their account anymore and so cannot chat with Hostinger staff.

The user experience to contact someone when there are technical issues is very poor. Also, they keep changing the parameters of the service you contract to buy like with Cyberpanle now requires a license for a free panel outside the VPS hosting. like paying for hosting twice.

Review.Titre: Easy to use, but lacks features. Limited customizability.
Review.Contenu: The editor is very limited in features compared to other available options from alternative companies. Basic functionality like keyboard controlled element placement/adjustment are missing. All elements in the editor should be able to be placed by the user at his/her discretion instead of simply being allowed "left / centered/ right" placement as it is with the header menu. Not having the ability to make a video a section background is a MAJOR problem for those wanting a more advanced site appearance. Also disappointing to not have parallax scrolling options. However, the options available are very easy to apply and the overall site quite intuitive to navigate. I'll use the webpage I complete on this platform as an interim site and rough draft, but will likely migrate to a different platform for my final, polished product.

Review.Titre: Can't restore the access to my account
Review.Contenu: I bought a hosting with a domain name for my son in August. Unfortunately he lost his Gmail password that had been used to log in. I wrote to the support and they sent me to the account recovery assistance. They asked for the photo of my card, the passport and the details about the account. I'm new to Hostinger. I took advantage of their black Friday upgrade but muddled through and made the mistake of creating a 2nd account instead. Now I have an account that I no longer want or need for the next few years living alongside a new account. I'm not a web developer or programmer but I am ok with tech. Still, I was lost in the interface and did my best to suck it up and wade through the mess I'd made with needing to transfer sites to my new account. I reached out through chat for help. I got a lot of generous help from Simonas. Thank you Simonas. His shift ended. I was passed onto Mantas who offered no help, only links and a fee to solve my problems. I asked for Simonas back, I was passed onto Fikri. Fikri picked up where Simonas left off with excellent help.The mess I created with my sites and account happened because I got lost on the Hostinger site between choices. The solution required creating sites, deleting sites, managing back end files and databases, and renaming backup folders, as well as resetting a password for an individual site. I was given links to follow that contained more links, and even then some steps that I was guided through weren't in the linked help.I'd like to give a higher rating for the fantastic help that 2 out of 3 people provided, but it was more than that. The resources aren't customer friendly meaning that not all help pages are helpful.

I recently moved my email accounts and websites from Bluehost to Hostinger, mainly because of poor customer support and higher prices at Bluehost. At Hostinger, customer support is improved in that the people I've worked with have not broken anything (as they often did at Bluehost), but as with Bluehost, only about one out of three did more than point me to the help pages I'd already read. In addition, to some extent you get what you pay for. Migration was not smooth, and now I'm bumping up against performance limits I hadn't encountered at Bluehost. Time will tell, for me, if this was a good move.

Review.Titre: Hostinger allows phishing pages to use their domain without taking any action
Review.Contenu: I have come across several phishing pages that deceive people into downloading Trojans onto their machines. These sites include capcutstudio.com ,capcutstudio.net ,capcuteditor.net , all of which are registered with Hostinger's Domain Name Service. It is evident that these websites are phishing pages, as they have copied the template from the legitimate company capcut.com. The downloads on these sites are clearly Trojans, as verified by various online virus scanner services and flagged by Google Safe Search as scam pages. However, the Hostinger staff responsible for abuse reports (abuse @ hostinger.com) appear to be quite ignorant. They don't take any substantial action and only request more "deep" information. The fact that these pages are phishing attempts is clear to the naked eye, evident through downloads and scans by online scanner services, and verified by Google Safe Search. I am deeply disappointed with the company's security quality and the lack of diligence and awareness among Hostinger staff regarding internet security. I cannot rate them higher than one star for their quality.Edit: After Hostinger's staff has seen this message, they cleared these phishing domains in less than 24 hours. Thank you very much; you saved many victims from these scams.

Review.Titre: It's cheap for a reason plus annoying popups
Review.Contenu: It's cheap. If you don't mind pop ups, annoying interfaces and absolutely worthless customer service then go for it.Update: they've added their own pop-ups that won't go away. Can't block them with Adblocker and every time I check mail I have to close their pop-ups.

Review.Titre: Domain registrar that only supported ancient algorithm for DNSSEC
Review.Contenu: Bought a domain name, its fine and received my domain instantly. Also relatively cheap compared to other registrar.The problem is with DNSSEC if to host DNS outside Hostinger, they only support only protocol 3, GOST R 34.11-94 which is almost 30 years now. That protocol while still supported by RFC, its highly unsecure and highly recommended against. But these Hostinger guys made it the only option available while other registrar already moved to the more secure protocol 2 SHA-256. So my domain end up with DNSSEC disabled because most DNS provider doesn't support the ancient protocol 3 anymore else I'm to use Hostinger own DNS hosting which I'm not keen. Terrible for security.

Review.Titre: Overall Hostinger is not a bad option

On the positive side, their pricing is very affordable, and their basic hosting plan offers a good set of features for the price. Their customer support is also quite responsive and helpful, and I appreciated their live chat option, which allowed me to get help quickly.However, I did run into some issues with their service that prevented me from giving them a higher rating. First of all, their uptime is not as reliable as I would have liked. I noticed several instances where my website was down for a few minutes at a time, which impacted my visitors' ability to access my site.Secondly, their user interface can be a bit confusing and overwhelming, especially for someone who is new to website hosting. The navigation could be improved, and I found it difficult to locate certain settings and features that I needed to use.Overall, I think Hostinger is a decent option for those on a budget, but there are definitely some areas where they could improve their service to provide a better experience for their users.

My initial perception when using Hostinger was very positive. However my good perception has deteriorated  substantially. I understood that this platform was about making it easy for a website designer to create a website without writing any code at all. In fact there appears to be instances where your own code, in order to get desired results. becomes mandatory. In my mind this defeats the object of using such a platform in the first place. After all the idea is to save time. One of the great experiences using Hostinger was it's 24/7 live chat window that could easily be accessed while designing the website. It was wonderful and easy to use. While on any navigation page you could simply click on an icon and help was immediately available. If, while conversing you navigated to another page, the chat window would follow so that it was easy to reference an item with the live specialist. For an inexplicable reason their design team has now altered the manner in which help is provided. The 24/7 chat window can now only be accessed via the account management page so that it makes it more difficult to refer to the problem you are experiencing and the chat window no longer pops up anywhere else. I consider such a change as counter productive as it makes it more difficult to raise issues and provides a poor user experience. Why FIX something that was working so well and degrade it?? Hostinger's form design is, in my mind, merely work in progress and does not meet all the facets a designer needs for a well thought out user experience. For example when a user clicks on the SUBMIT button a message is displayed to the user BUT there is no way to set it's font size, font color or placement on the page. Neither is there a way to control how long it should be displayed and the form is not reset until the user navigates to another page. Their web builder lacks a carousel element, text boxes can not have a encompassing border, their image gallery element is very difficult to use with images of different proportions, and they do not support domain names ending with (.co.za ). However, the client is quick to be reminded that all these features may be brought about by using other CMS plans, writing additional code, embedding code snippets or changing NameServers or DNS settings. BUT does this make for a good user friendly experience? I don't think so. Often I ask myself why their design team does not focus on the lacking facilities instead of FIXING and making worse systems that are working well (such as their 24/7 chat window). With the exception of one single chat experience with one bad moment their live specialist are very helpful. Still if I were asked to rate Hostinger as a whole I would have moved from an initial score of 10/10 to 5/10. It's a great pity because they have the capacity to be right at the TOP of hosting and website design platforms available  on the internet.

I am still waiting for their response and will update my comment once things are resolved.Another update as on 28th Nov: Finally they found the root cause which was on their end and resolved the issue. My trust in Hostinger is back after 12+ days of struggling and hunting for a solution. I am updating my rating to 4 for that reason. This is due to the efforts of Manuel who helped me like a pro!

Review.Titre: I was unhappy with my existing hosting…
Review.Contenu: I was unhappy with my existing hosting provider so I researched the alternatives and found Hostinger. I have 4 websites and as my plan was due for renewal, I decided to take the great offer of a 4 year plan. This last week I started the transition and generally it went well. I moved the 4 websites and set up email accounts and transferred my old emails. My only issues were in what order to do things. Should I try and transfer email before switching nameservers? The online help was less than clear. I wasted a lot of time trying to get emails transferred and it was confusing as now I was dealing with Hostinger and Titan. Trying to sort out where the problem lay cost a lot of time. When I transferred a website I needed help as the site wouldn't load. I was told to enable Lightspeed cache and flush it....again, I wasted a lot of time. A set of documented steps in chronological order to undertake the transfer would be welcomed and not leave us trying to get help from both Hostinger and Titan.Other than that, the onboarding went well and the ability to transfer old emails to the new email account is something I haven't seen with any other hosting company.Website performance is excellent and now I have discovered how to do things, I will be recommending Hostinger to my clients as their plans on other providers come up for renewal. I will also be recommending Hostinger for all my new clients. I would have given 5 stars were it not for the confusing information on how to transfer websites and emails.Also, to be honest I find the hPanel confusing to work with though I guess I'll get used to it in time.I've watched several youtube videos about Hostinger and am really impressed with their roadmap - I'm also really impressed with the pricing. For my clients who have a good deal of traffic I have used Siteground in the past but Hostinger performance is just as good if not better for a  fraction of the price.

But when I wanted to use a simple mailto command, I couldn't find a way to exercise it using web builder. I finally entered the http code, but was unable to format the result.

Review.Titre: Hostinger is a great value for the money.
Review.Contenu: Overall, I'm happy with the price-to-performance ratio I'm getting from Hostinger. The plans are very affordable, and the features are great for a beginner or small business. (I use Hostinger for 2 years now, I used before one.com I pay now 1/3 of what I paid by one.com for the same price!)Pros:Affordable: Hostinger's plans are some of the most affordable on the market.Great features: Hostinger offers a wide range of features, including unlimited bandwidth, free SSL certificates, and a free domain name for the first year.Easy to use: Hostinger's control panel is easy to use, even for beginners.Cons:Helpdesk: The helpdesk can be difficult to reach at times.Server speed: Server speed can be slower if you're located in a different region than the server.Specific feedback:Helpdesk: I've had to contact the helpdesk a few times, and it's been hit or miss. Sometimes I've been able to get help quickly, but other times I've had to wait a long time for a response.Server speed: My blog has readers in the US, Europe, and Australia. I've noticed that the server speed is slower for my Australian readers than for my US or European readers. I'm not sure if this is because the server is located in Europe or if it's something else.Overall thoughts:Overall, I'm happy with Hostinger. The price is right, the features are great, and the control panel is easy to use. However, the helpdesk can be difficult to reach at times, and the server speed can be slower if you're located in a different region than the server.Recommendation:I would recommend Hostinger to anyone looking for affordable web hosting with great features. However, if you're located in a different region than the server, you may want to consider a different provider.Additional tips:If you're concerned about server speed, you can choose a server location that is closer to your target audience. You can also use a CDN, such as Cloudflare, to improve performance for users in different regions.

Review.Titre: Let's dissect what makes Hostinger shine:
Review.Contenu: I'm not just happy with Hostinger, I'm ecstatic! This isn't just another mediocre web hosting provider. It's a dream come true for anyone who values speed, reliability, and top-notch customer service.Let's dissect what makes Hostinger shine:Lightning-fast performance: Websites load at breakneck speed! Forget frustrating lag and lost visitors. Hostinger's servers are optimized for peak performance, and it shows. My website has never been zippier.24/7 live chat that actually delivers: No more waiting an eternity for help. Their friendly and knowledgeable support team is always just a click away, ready to solve any issue with lightning speed (pun intended!). I've never had a question go unanswered, and their solutions are always helpful and clear.Seamless user experience: Managing your website with Hostinger is a breeze. Their control panel is intuitive and easy to navigate, even for complete beginners. Plus, they offer a ton of helpful tutorials and guides to get you started.More than just hosting: Hostinger goes beyond the basics. They offer a variety of hosting options to suit your needs, from shared hosting to cloud hosting and even VPS plans. Plus, they have a ton of extras like website builders, free domain names, and SSL certificates.Unbeatable value: Let's not forget the elephant in the room - the price! Hostinger's plans are incredibly affordable, making them a perfect choice for budget-conscious individuals and businesses alike. You're getting so much value for your money, it's almost unbelievable.Honestly, I could go on and on about how much I love Hostinger. But at the end of the day, it all boils down to this: it's made my life easier and my website better. If you're looking for a web hosting provider that ticks all the boxes and then some, look no further than Hostinger. You won't be disappointed!

I was having trouble with accessing the website after uploading all the files and database to the Hostinger server so I contacted their technical specialists over the "Chat Facility"  A very friendly helpful young lady called Zhi very quickly understood my problem and enabled me to identify two small errors which had fatal consequences.  Correction of these errors was quickly established and the website now works perfectly again - so my sincere thanks to Zhi who also gave me some useful tips on how to identify these errors in the future.  I have also been very impressed with the facilities on the Hostinger website  which greatly helps the administration of the website  - far superior to those of my old host provider.So well done Hostinger, I would recommend to anyone contemplating setting up a website or, indeed, looking for a new host provider.
